'''''A Philological Miscellany Presented to Eilert Ekwall''''' is a 1942 [[Wikipedia:Festschrift|Festschrift]] presented to mark the occasion of the sixty-fifth birthday of [[Wikipedia:Eilert Ekwall|Eilert Ekwall]], Professor of English at [[Wikipedia:Lund University|Lund University]], Sweden. It constitutes vol. XIV and vol. XV of ''Studia Neophilologica''.<ref>{{webcite|author=W. E. Collinson|articleurl=http://www.jstor.org/discover/10.2307/3717551?uid=3738984&uid=2&uid=4&sid=21102567407017|articlename=Review: ''A Philological Miscellany''|dated=|website=[http://www.jstor.org/ ''The Modern Language Review'', Vol. 38, No. 4, October 1943 (at JSTOR.org)]|accessed=28 July 2013}}</ref>

The volume includes an introductory note signed by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], Kenneth Sisam, [[R.W. Chambers]], J. Turville-Petre, [[Charles Leslie Wrenn|C.L. Wrenn]], and others.<ref>{{CG|C}}, p. 252</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=Andrew Wells|articleurl=http://www.facebook.com/groups/TheTolkienSociety.EducationalCharity/permalink/10151761499381068/|articlename=(Untitled)|dated=23 July 2013|website=[http://www.facebook.com/groups/TheTolkienSociety.EducationalCharity/ The Tolkien Society Facebook group]|accessed=28 July 2013}}</ref>
